Description: A profile view of the life-size head of a bearded Graeco-Egyptian mummy; the skin blackened and shrivelled; the eyes sunken; the teeth protruding slightly from the lips; remnants of gilding still adhering in parts; illustration to Pettigrew's "A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians" (1834) Aquatint
Bibliographic references: Reid 1871 / A descriptive catalogue of the works of George Cruikshank (1623)
Associated titles: A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians
